missionProperties.missionDescription: If playing a mini campaign, heroes must bring a Spectre ally that they have not brought to a mission during this mini campaign. ==== Upon hearing that his commander during the Clone Wars, Wolffe, is not only alive but an ally to the Rebellion, CT-1701 volunteers his team to travel to Seelos to pick up useful intelligence gathered from Wolffe's stolen AT-AT walker. But the Empire arrives first, pursuing Wolffe's walker with their own armored war machines.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.name: Crate1
entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.name: Crate3
entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText: As you approach the coordinates you got from Wolffe, you see the barren landscape of Seelos stretched out before you.

eventActions.theText:
From up here, the towering war machines in the desert almost look like toys. Your pilot accelerates towards them, and soon the true size of the intimidating AT-AT walkers becomes obvious.

{-} The Seelos map and all tokens on it cannot be affected by card effects.

Wolffe's walker is battered with scorch marks. 

{-} The Rebel mission token represents the Rebel AT-AT.
Behind Wolffe's walker, two more AT-ATs loom in the distance. Their lumbering steps look slow, but they are in hot pursuit of Wolffe, their cannons blazing.

{-} The Imperial mission tokens represent the Imperial AT-ATs.
{-} AT-ATs have Health: 9, Defense: None, Attack: {O} 1 blue die and Speed 1.
{-} Rebel mission tokens are Rebel figures and Imperial mission tokens are Imperial figures. 
{-} Rebel AT-ATs cannot attack.
{-} AT-ATs do not activate as normal. Instead, at the end of the activation phase, each Rebel AT-AT activates. Then, each Imperial AT-AT activates.
"Brace", your pilot says. "I'm going down." Your shuttle lands on top of one of the walkers, and you breach it through an escape hatch.

You climb down and find yourselves facing down a full contingent of Imperial troops.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.

If you want to give Wolffe a fighting chance, you need to seize this walker as soon as possible.

{-} The mission will progress when the Rebels reach the cockpit.
{-} When a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, click the highlight on the Seelos map and select "Rebel AT-AT defeated".
{-} The Rebels lose when a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, at the end of Round 5, or when all heroes are wounded.

entityProperties.name: AT-AT Highlight
entityProperties.theText: When a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, click "Rebel AT-AT defeated".

eventActions.theText: Reach the cockpit.

{-} The Seelos map and all tokens on it cannot be affected by card effects.
{-} The Rebel mission token represents the Rebel AT-AT.
{-} The Imperial mission tokens represent the Imperial AT-ATs.
{-} AT-ATs have Health: 9, Defense: None, Attack: {P} 1 blue die and Speed 1.
{-} Rebel mission tokens are Rebel figures and Imperial mission tokens are Imperial figures.
{-} Rebel AT-ATs cannot attack.
{-} AT-ATs do not activate as normal. Instead, at the end of the activation phase, each Rebel AT-AT activates. Then, each Imperial AT-AT activates.
{-} The mission will progress when the Rebels reach the cockpit.
{-} When a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, click the highlight on the Seelos map and select "Rebel AT-AT defeated".
{-} The Rebels lose when a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, at the end of Round 5, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
The Imperial walker explodes in a ball of fire. The clone commanders are safe once more.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} If CT-1701 is a hero, he receives the “Bullseye!” Reward card. Otherwise, heroes receive 150 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
You are forced to retreat back to your shuttle. You are just taking off when you see a burst of walker fire sever a leg from the clone commanders' AT-AT, toppling it over.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.theText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

globalEvents.name: Mini campaign Win
globalEvents.eventText:
Wolffe hails you, transmitting their stolen codes on an encrypted channel. The grizzled clone looks almost jovial. “I know clankers who put up more of a fight than those new troopers. We owe you one, kid.”

At your next scheduled rendezvous, the Spectres welcome the news that Wolffe and Gregor are safe. Sabine checks Wolffe’ stolen codes. “We can use these for a while before the Imperials catch on,” she says.

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText:
Please select the correct option below.

{-} Extended campaign 1: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with the Ezra Bridger / Kanan Jarrus Ally Pack.
{-} Extended campaign 2: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with Sabine Wren / Zeb Orrelios Ally Pack Pack.
{-} Extended campaign 3: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with both Ally Packs.
{-} Mini campaign: I'm playing the regular "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign without any of the above Ally Packs.

globalEvents.name: Mini campaign Defeat
globalEvents.eventText:
You lay low for nearly a week until your next rendezvous with the Ghost. The mood among the Spectres is solemn when they hear the news. Ezra is the first to break the silence. 

“Wolffe and Gregor  survived the Clone Wars. They can survive this.”

“We all should've been there,” growls Zeb.

“I'm sure everyone did what they could,” Hera says.

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText:
Please select the correct option below.

{-} Extended campaign 1: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with the Ezra Bridger / Kanan Jarrus Ally Pack.
{-} Extended campaign 2: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with Sabine Wren / Zeb Orrelios Ally Pack Pack.
{-} Extended campaign 3: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with both Ally Packs.
{-} Mini campaign: I'm playing the regular "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign without any of the above Ally Packs.

globalEvents.name: No campaign
globalEvents.eventText:
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Extended campaign 1
globalEvents.eventText:
“We're keeping our heads down,” Hera tells you. “What we most need now is something to distract Thrawn.”

You contact your Lothal informant, the droid N-4M, who is happy to hear from you — at least, as happy as an analyst droid can be. “You have been causing the local garrison some discomfort. They are preparing for the possibility of a larger Rebel strike.”

N-4M shifts its holodisplay to focus on Lothal’s surface. “The Empire is driving their forced labor harder than ever. One officer in particular, Colonel Xarok, is quickly gaining a reputation for his particularly... aggressive practices.”

{-} The next active mission is “Executive Overreach” (Ezra & Kanan Ally Pack).

globalEvents.name: Extended campaign 2
globalEvents.eventText:
“We're keeping our heads down,” Hera tells you. “What we most need now is something to distract Thrawn.”

You contact your Lothal informant, the droid N-4M, who is happy to hear from you — at least, as happy as an analyst droid can be. “You have been causing the local garrison some discomfort. They are preparing for the possibility of a larger Rebel strike.”

N-4M pulls up a diagram of Imperial supply routes leading to Lothal. “Several Wookiee laborers recently rebelled at a labor camp directly connected to Thrawn's activities. Their uprising failed, and the Empire is now threatening reprisal against their families. Perhaps you could intervene on the Wookiees’ behalf.”

{-} The next active mission is “Intimidation Factor” (Sabine & Zeb Ally Pack).

globalEvents.name: Extended campaign 3
globalEvents.eventText:
“We're keeping our heads down,” Hera tells you. “What we most need now is something to distract Thrawn.”

You contact your Lothal informant, the droid N-4M, who is happy to hear from you — at least, as happy as an analyst droid can be. “You have been causing the local garrison some discomfort. They are preparing for the possibility of a larger Rebel strike.”

N-4M shifts its holodisplay to focus on Lothal’s surface. “The Empire is driving their forced labor harder than ever. One officer in particular, Colonel Xarok, is quickly gaining a reputation for his particularly... aggressive practices.”

N-4M pulls up a diagram of Imperial supply routes leading to Lothal. “Several Wookiee laborers recently rebelled at a labor camp directly connected to Thrawn's activities. Their uprising failed, and the Empire is now threatening reprisal against their families. Perhaps you could intervene on the Wookiees’ behalf.”

{-} The heroes collectively choose whether to attack Colonel Xarok or help the Wookiees.
{-} If the heroes choose to attack Colonel Xarok, the next active mission is “Executive Overreach” (Ezra & Kanan Ally Pack).
{-} If the heroes choose to help the Wookiees, the next active mission is “Intimidation Factor” (Sabine & Zeb Ally Pack).

globalEvents.name: Regular mini campaign
globalEvents.eventText:
Aboard the Ghost, you find Hera and Sabine scrutinizing the remains of an E-XD infiltrator droid. “We've found more than one of these things trying to follow us lately,’" Hera says. “And Thrawn isn't letting up. We need to even the odds.”

“So we give them something else to worry about,” suggests Sabine. “Even if it only ties up some stormtroopers. We didn't get to stay on Geonosis long enough for me to check, but I think we might be able to get some of those old battle droids working.”

“Or,” Hera puts in, “we can try to help the Twi'lek rebels on Ryloth. The Empire’s been intercepting their supplies for a while now. If we can help them put up more of a fight, that will be one more thing for Thrawn to worry about.”

{-} The heroes collectively choose whether to check out the droid factory or assist the Twi'lek rebels.
{-} If the heroes choose to check out the droid factory, the next active mission is “Siege on Geonosis”.
{-} If the heroes choose to assist the Twi'lek rebels, the next active mission is “Race on Ryloth”.

globalEvents.name: AT-AT Activation uncaptured
globalEvents.eventText:
The entire floor sways as the AT-ATs lumber on.

{-} Activate the Rebel AT-AT. The Rebel AT-AT cannot attack.
{-} Then, each Imperial AT-AT resolves the following instructions, starting with the AT-AT farther away from the Rebel AT-AT:

{A} Move 1 toward the Rebel AT-AT.
{Q} Attack the Rebel AT-AT.

(AT-ATs have Health: 9, Defense: None, Attack: {P} 1 blue die and Speed 1.)

globalEvents.name: AT-AT Activation captured
globalEvents.eventText:
The entire floor sways as the AT-ATs lumber on.

{-} Activate both Rebel AT-ATs.
{-} At the start of the captured AT-AT's activation, a hero on or adjacent to the steering control (blue terminal) may test {I} or {J}. If successful, the captured AT-AT gains 1 movement point.
{-} At the start of the captured AT-AT's activation, a hero on or adjacent to the fire control (red terminal) may test {I} or {J}. If successful, the captured AT-AT gains 1 {h}.

{-} After the Rebel AT-ATs' activations, the Imperial AT-AT resolves the following instructions:

{A} Move 1 toward the Rebel AT-AT that has suffered the most {H}.
{Q} Attack the Rebel AT-AT that has suffered the most {H}.

(AT-ATs have Health: 9, Defense: None, Attack: {P} 1 blue die and Speed 1.)

globalEvents.name: Foresection entered
globalEvents.eventText: You open the door only to find yourself face to face with more troops.

entityProperties.name: Mid Section Door
entityProperties.theText: A sturdy door leads deeper into the AT-AT.

globalEvents.name: Cockpit breached
globalEvents.eventText: You breach the door to the cockpit and storm in.

entityProperties.name: Cockpit Door
entityProperties.theText: A sturdy door leads into the AT-AT cockpit.

eventActions.theText: Immediately, the AT-AT's crew turns towards you.
Behind the troops, you can see the walker's controls, ready for the taking.

entityProperties.name: Steering control
entityProperties.theText:
The steering controls the walker's movement.

{-} A hero can interact with either terminal to take control of the walker.

entityProperties.name: Fire control
entityProperties.theText:
The fire control coordinates the walker's cannons.

{-} A hero can interact with either terminal to take control of the walker.

eventActions.theText:
{-} A hero can interact with either terminal to take control of the walker.
{-} The mission will progress when a hero takes control of the walker.
Block access to the terminals.
Take control of the walker.

{-} The Seelos map and all tokens on it cannot be affected by card effects.
{-} The Rebel mission token represents the Rebel AT-AT.
{-} The Imperial mission tokens represent the Imperial AT-ATs.
{-} AT-ATs have Health: 9, Defense: None, Attack: {P} 1 blue die and Speed 1.
{-} Rebel mission tokens are Rebel figures and Imperial mission tokens are Imperial figures.
{-} Rebel AT-ATs cannot attack.
{-} AT-ATs do not activate as normal. Instead, at the end of the activation phase, each Rebel AT-AT activates. Then, each Imperial AT-AT activates.
{-} A hero can interact with either terminal to take control of the walker.
{-} The mission will progress when a hero takes control of the walker.
{-} When a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, click the highlight on the Seelos map and select "Rebel AT-AT defeated".
{-} The Rebels lose when a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, at the end of Round 5, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Commandeered
globalEvents.eventText:
You wrestle control from the Imperials and take the seat of the pilot yourself. "Well done!", shouts Wolffe over com. "Now let's bring the fight to them, eh?" Outside, you can see Wolffe's AT-AT slowly turning towards his former pursuers. The hunt is on.

{-} The mission no longer ends at the end of Round 5.
{-} Flip one Imperial AT-AT to the Rebel side. This is the captured AT-AT. 
{-} Rebel AT-ATs can now attack.

eventActions.theText:
{-} At the start of the captured AT-AT's activation, a hero on or adjacent to the steering control (blue terminal) may test {I} or {J}. If successful, the captured AT-AT gains 1 movement point.
{-} At the start of the captured AT-AT's activation, a hero on or adjacent to the fire control (red terminal) may test {I} or {J}. If successful, the captured AT-AT gains 1 {h}.
{-} When a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, click the highlight on the Seelos map and select "Rebel AT-AT defeated". When an Imperial AT-AT is defeated, click the highlight on the Seelos map and select "Imperial AT-AT defeated".
{-} The Rebels win when the Imperial AT-AT is defeated.

entityProperties.name: AT-AT Highlight
entityProperties.theText:
When a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, click "Rebel AT-AT defeated".
When an Imperial AT-AT is defeated, click "Imperial AT-AT defeated".

entityProperties.name: Fire control

{-} At the start of the captured AT-AT's activation, a hero on or adjacent to the fire control may test {I} or {J}. If successful, the captured AT-AT gains 1 {h}.

eventActions.theText: Destroy the Imperial AT-AT.

{-} The Seelos map and all tokens on it cannot be affected by card effects.
{-} The Rebel mission tokens represents the Rebel AT-ATs.
{-} The Imperial mission token represent the Imperial AT-AT.
{-} AT-ATs have Health: 9, Defense: None, Attack: {P} 1 blue die and Speed 1.
{-} Rebel mission tokens are Rebel figures and Imperial mission tokens are Imperial figures.
{-} AT-ATs do not activate as normal. Instead, at the end of the activation phase, each Rebel AT-AT activates. Then, each Imperial AT-AT activates.
{-} At the start of the captured AT-AT's activation, a hero on or adjacent to the steering control (blue terminal) may test {I} or {J}. If successful, the captured AT-AT gains 1 movement point.
{-} At the start of the captured AT-AT's activation, a hero on or adjacent to the fire control (red terminal) may test {I} or {J}. If successful, the captured AT-AT gains 1 {h}.
{-} When a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, click the highlight on the Seelos map and select "Rebel AT-AT defeated". When an Imperial AT-AT is defeated, click the highlight on the Seelos map and select "Imperial AT-AT defeated".
{-} The Rebels win when the Imperial AT-AT is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when a Rebel AT-AT is defeated, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Intruder Alert
globalEvents.eventText: More troops rush in to stop you from commandeering the AT-AT.
